results.question: When securing a laptop, it can be placed in an office or a desk drawer.
The testing stage is a 'quality assurance' test to verify that the code functions as intended.
Static program analyzers are tools that examine the software without actually executing the program; instead, the source code is reviewed and analyzed.
Which OS hardening technique removes all unnecessary features that may compromise an operating system?
What is the name for a cumulative package of all patches and hot-fixes as well as additional features up to a given point?
What type of storage is used on mobile devices?
Which statement about a mantrap is true?
results.correct_answer: It monitors and controls two interlocking doors to a room.
results.incorrect_answers__001: It requires the use of a cipher lock.
results.incorrect_answers__002: It is illegal in the United States.
results.incorrect_answers__003: It is a special keyed lock.
results.explanation: It monitors and controls two interlocking doors to a room.
incorrect_answers: It requires the use of a cipher lock.
It is illegal in the United States.
It is a special keyed lock.
results.answer1: It monitors and controls two interlocking doors to a room.
results.answer2: It requires the use of a cipher lock.
results.answer3: It is illegal in the United States.
results.answer4: It is a special keyed lock.

results.question: MDM tools cannot provide the ability to detect and restrict jailbroken and rooted devices.
As a class, tablets are devices that closely resemble standard desktop computers.
Some mobile devices can be configured so that the device automatically unlocks and stays unlocked until a specific action occurs.
Which of the following can replace using radio frequency (RF) for the communication media?
Which of the following is NOT an Android Smart Lock configuration option?
A QR code can't contain which of the following items directly?
Which type of OS is typically found on an embedded system?

Agape was asked to make a recommendation regarding short-range wireless technologies to be supported in a new conference room that was being renovated. Which of the following would she NOT consider due to its slow speed and its low deployment levels today?
Tightening security during the design and coding of an OS is called 'locking'
One tool for change management is version control software that allows changes to be automatically recorded and if necessary 'rolled back' to a previous version of the software.
An independently rotating large cup affixed to the top of a fence prevents the hands of intruders from gripping the top of a fence to climb over it. What is the name for this technology?
What security standard was introduced in conjunction with UEFI?
Why should the account lockout threshold not be set too low?
results.correct_answer: It could result in denial of service (DoS) attacks.
results.incorrect_answers__001: The user would not have to wait too long to have her password reset.
results.incorrect_answers__002: The network administrator would have to reset the account manually.
results.incorrect_answers__003: It could decrease calls to the help desk.
results.explanation: It could result in denial of service (DoS) attacks.
incorrect_answers: The user would not have to wait too long to have her password reset.
The network administrator would have to reset the account manually.
It could decrease calls to the help desk.
results.answer1: It could result in denial of service (DoS) attacks.
results.answer2: The user would not have to wait too long to have her password reset.
results.answer3: The network administrator would have to reset the account manually.
results.answer4: It could decrease calls to the help desk.

results.question: _____ biometrics is related to the perception, thought processes, and understanding of the user.
Creating a pattern of where a user accesses a remote web account is an example of which of the following?
Which human characteristic is NOT used for biometric identification?
Which authentication factor is based on a unique talent that a user possesses?
Which of the following options prevents a logon after a set number of failed logon attempts within a specified period and can also specify the length of time that the lockout is in force?
The use of what item below involves the creation of a large pre-generated data set of candidate digests?
Which of the following accounts is a user account that is created explicitly to provide a security context for services running on a server?
What type of attack involves using every possible combination of letters, numbers, and characters to create candidate digests that are then matched against those in a stolen digest file?
Most password attacks today are an offline attack.
Open ID Connect is an Authentication protocol that can be used in OAuth 2.0 as a standard means to obtain user identity.
Brute force attacks can be very slow because every character combination must be generated.
Which type of password attack is a more targeted brute force attack that uses placeholders for characters in certain positions of the password?
Which authentication factor is based on a unique talent that a user possesses?
Using one authentication credential to access multiple accounts or applications is known as _____.
What framework is used for transporting authentication protocols instead of the authentication protocol itself?
A vulnerable process that is divided between two or more individuals to prevent fraudulent application of the process is known as which of the following?
Which access control model can dynamically assign roles to subjects based on a set of defined rules?
What type of computer can forward RADIUS messages between RADIUS clients and RADIUS servers?

What standard provides a greater degree of security by implementing port-based authentication and blocks all traffic on a port-by-port basis until the client is authenticated using credentials stored on an authentication server?
Least privilege in access control means that only the minimum amount of privileges necessary to perform a job or function should be allocated.
A Local Group Policy (LGP) has more options than a Group Policy.
Permission auditing and review is intended to examine the permissions that a user has been given to determine if each is still necessary.
ACLs provide file system security for protecting files managed by the user.
Rule-Based Access Control can be changed by users.
How is the Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) used?
results.correct_answer: It allows secure web domains to exchange user authentication and authorization data.
results.incorrect_answers__001: It is an authenticator in IEEE 802.1x.
results.incorrect_answers__002: It is no longer used because it has been replaced by LDAP.
results.incorrect_answers__003: It is a backup to a RADIUS server.
results.explanation: It allows secure web domains to exchange user authentication and authorization data.
incorrect_answers: It is an authenticator in IEEE 802.1x.
It is no longer used because it has been replaced by LDAP.
It is a backup to a RADIUS server.
results.answer1: It allows secure web domains to exchange user authentication and authorization data.
results.answer2: It is an authenticator in IEEE 802.1x.
results.answer3: It is no longer used because it has been replaced by LDAP.
results.answer4: It is a backup to a RADIUS server.

results.question: Which of the following involves rights given to access specific resources?
A RADIUS authentication server requires the ________ to be authenticated first.
Which access control model is the most restrictive?
What is the secure version of LDAP?
A vulnerable process that is divided between two or more individuals to prevent fraudulent application of the process is known as which of the following?
Select the XML standard that allows secure web domains to exchange user authentication and authorization data and is used extensively for online e-commerce transactions.
Which of the following is a simpler subset of Directory Access Protocol?
To assist with controlling orphaned and dormant accounts, what can be used to indicate when an account is no longer active?
Which access control model is considered to be the least restrictive?
With the Discretionary Access Control (DAC) model, no object has an owner; the system has total control over that object.
Authentication, authorization, and accounting are sometimes called AAA.
Employee onboarding refers to the tasks associated with hiring a new employee.
What can be used to provide both file system security and database security?
Which of the following is NOT true regarding how an enterprise should handle an orphaned or dormant account?
results.correct_answer: All orphaned and dormant accounts should be deleted immediately whenever they are discovered.
results.incorrect_answers__001: Access should be ended as soon as the employee is no longer part of the organization.
results.incorrect_answers__002: A formal procedure should be in place for disabling accounts for employees who are dismissed, resign, or retire from the organization.
results.incorrect_answers__003: Logs should be monitored because current employees are sometimes tempted to use an older dormant account instead of their own account.
results.explanation: All orphaned and dormant accounts should be deleted immediately whenever they are discovered.
incorrect_answers: Access should be ended as soon as the employee is no longer part of the organization.
A formal procedure should be in place for disabling accounts for employees who are dismissed, resign, or retire from the organization.
Logs should be monitored because current employees are sometimes tempted to use an older dormant account instead of their own account.
results.answer1: All orphaned and dormant accounts should be deleted immediately whenever they are discovered.
results.answer2: Access should be ended as soon as the employee is no longer part of the organization.
results.answer3: A formal procedure should be in place for disabling accounts for employees who are dismissed, resign, or retire from the organization.
results.answer4: Logs should be monitored because current employees are sometimes tempted to use an older dormant account instead of their own account.
